title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of ticket using variables.The box office sold $$360$$ tickets, so you can represent general admission tickets as $$(360-s)$$, and you can represent student tickets simply as s.
speech: Represent the number of each type of ticket using variables.The box office sold  360  tickets, so you can represent general admission tickets as , parentheses 360 minus s,  , and you can represent student tickets simply as s.

tickets, so you can represent general admission tickets as  ,  360 minus s,
, and you can represent student tickets simply as s.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the number of each ticket type(in variable form) by its respective value.
speech: Multiply the number of each ticket type(in variable form) by its respective value.
pacedSpeech: Multiply the number of each ticket type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their monetary values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{15}\left(360-s\right)+10s=4170$$
speech: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their monetary values into a single equation. This will be  15 of, parentheses 360 minus s,  plus 10 s is equal to 4170

title: Substitution
text: Plug s into the original relationship between the passes to find g.
speech: Plug s into the original relationship between the passes to find g.
pacedSpeech: Plug s into the original relationship between the passes to find g.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is $$114$$ general and $$246$$ student.
speech: The answer is  114  general and  246,  student.
